headerSection.secondaryText: A resource for kids to find fun and educational materials related to environmental issues world is facing today.

headerSection.title: Contact Us
headerSection.subtitle: Here you can share your game suggestions, questions, comments with us.

matchingGame.title: Matching Game
matchingGame.subtitle: Let's power up our environment vocabulary! Drag words to the matching pictures.

puzzleGame.title: Image Puzzle
puzzleGame.subtitle: Put the pieces in the correct order to see the full picture!
puzzleGame.howToPlayDescription: Click on one tile to select it then click on the other tile to swap their places. Place all cards in their correct order to see the full image.

memoryGame.title: Memory Game
memoryGame.header: Test your memory to reveal facts!
memoryGame.howToPlayDescription: Click on a card to reveal image behind and match it by clicking on a card with same image.

cards.phrase: Did you know that volcanoe eruptions can cause acid rain?
Did you know that even 2000 years ago Romans were complaining about air pollution?
Did you know that a single wind turbine can power thousand homes?
Did you know that in 2020, 338 million tons of hazardous waste was produced?
Did you know that in 100 years, there will be no rainforrests?
Did you know that Earth is still in an Ice Age which started 2.5 million years ago?
Did you know that from 1850 to 2019 2,400,000,000,000 tons of CO2 was emitted by human activity?
Did you know that every year 2,120,000,000 tons of waste dumped on planet?
Did you know that between 1961 and 2016 9,000,000,000,000 tons of Earth's glacier was lost?
Did you know that ozone layer will not be fully recovered until around 2070?
Did you know that recycling 1 aluminum can saves enough energy to light a 100 watt light bulb for 20 hours and a TV for 2 hours?
Did you know that the Earth has garbage islands the size of continents floating in our oceans?

about.aboutUsText: We are a group of multi-national developers who found their common ground in using tech for the benefit of people. Juniper, consists of a group of 5 junior developers and 1 lead engineer working together to educate children in MENA about environmental issues and climate change through educational games. Our target group is kids living in MENA that are 5-9 years old; thus, Juniper is delivered in three main languages to help kids and their teachers/parents to easily surf the website.
about.whyWeDoItText: We have a moral obligation to preserve nature and its features, because protecting the environment protects humanity from toxic substances and our quality of food. We believe that the new generation in MENA should be supported with the right tools to believe and act for the benefit of humanitarian and social issues, on the local and global scale. Given the right tools, it is not impossible to raise a generation of activists.

louis.name: Louis Li
louis.bio: Louis is the coding instructor in Re:Coded Turkey. He has a lot of exciting stories to tell. He creates the butterfly effect for people around him.

ammar.name: Ammar Sammour
ammar.bio: Ammar is the Coding Instructor at Re:Coded Front-end Web Development Bootcamp in Turkey! He spends his time coaching our fellows to become web development ninjas!

ibrahim.name: Ibrahim Aljarad
ibrahim.bio: Ibrahim studied coding at Flatiron School and economics at Alfurat University. He attended Re-Coded's front-end web development bootcamp. He had many experiences outside of coding too. He worked with several news channels and agencies as an engineer.

majd.name: Majd Ajroudi
majd.bio: A junior developer with versatile skills, experience in several engineering areas and keen interest in using tech to solve social issues.

sule.name: Sule Sinikoglu
sule.bio: A web developer who writes "good code" for creating positive impact on Global Challenges.

tarkan.name: Tarkan Mansuroglu
tarkan.bio: A Re:Coded Front-End Web Development Bootcamp trained and partially self-taught front-end web developer. He is also a passionate learner, PC enthusiast, gamer and fitness enthusiast. He loves solving real life problems to test and develop his skills. Follow him through social media!

yaman.name: Mohamad Yaman Sammani
yaman.bio: Yaman is a junior Front-End web developer graduated from Re:Coded Bootcamp in November 2020. His passion is to design programs that support easy access to services for migrants in host countries.

terms: We may collect the following information: Name, Contact information and email address.
We are committed to ensuring that your information is secure.
Our website may contain links to other websites of interest. However, once you have used these links to leave our site, you should note that we do not have any control over that other website.

climateChangeHandbook.title: Our Climate Change
climateChangeHandbook.text: This book is a child friendly handbook meant to explain the concepts of climate change in an easily understandable manner and language. It aims to link behavioural choices to the changes observed in our climate.

educationOnClimateChangeHandbook.title: Resources for Education on Climate Change - UNESCO
educationOnClimateChangeHandbook.text: This publication focuses on the challenges, opportunities and good practices of climate change.

whoCausesClimateChangesHandbook.title: Who Causes Climate Changes - TROCAIRE
whoCausesClimateChangesHandbook.text: Children explore who contribute to climate change by looking at activities related to climate change using climate change bingo sheet

resourcesPage.title: Resources Centre
resourcesPage.aboutPage: Juniper's Resource Centre is an online library that hosts comprehensive, reliable, and up-to-date information on thematic areas related to Environmental. The website is open to the public, free-of-charge, and provides access to materials in one convenient location. This page will be updated regularly.
